Title: Incorporating Prints and Textures into Your Wardrobe

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of adding prints and patterns to your wardrobe
Content.Text: Adding prints and patterns to your wardrobe can elevate your style and make your outfits more interesting. It's an easy way to show that you've put thought into your look and can add value to your current wardrobe.

To ease into incorporating prints, start by adding them underneath your outfits, such as a printed shirt under a suit or a printed sock. You can also incorporate prints through accessories like scarves, bags, or socks.

Contrary to popular belief, you can mix prints. Classic prints like stripes, polka dots, animal prints, and florals are versatile and can be mixed with more contemporary prints. Experiment with layering prints and finding complementary colors to create a chic look.

Changing the textures of your clothing can add interest to your outfits. Start by replacing simple fabrics with different textures, such as cotton with linen or wool with fleece. Mixing textures can create a visually appealing look when done thoughtfully.

Leather and suede are timeless textures that can easily be incorporated into your wardrobe. They pair well with a variety of outfits and can be mixed together for a chic look. Don't be afraid to experiment with faux leather and faux fur as well.
